column1: | * Dwell times may be varied during the production of timings for trains in conjunction with engineering work or   |                |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |

| other special traffic arrangements at the discretion of the Amended Timetable Manager.                            |                |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |

| running ECS in the same                                                                                           | 4 (7-12 cars)* |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |

| $ An actual minimum dwell time of 45 seconds is required at all station stops. As timetable systems can only use  |                |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |

| multiples of 30 seconds, every second station stop must have a dwell time of at least 1 minute input into the     |                |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |

| * By exception, allowances for trains terminating and then running ECS in the same direction may be reduced after |                |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |

| discussion and agreement between the operator and Network Rail.                                                   |                |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |

| Resetting of route for a departing                                                                                | 1              |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |

| service following the arrival of a                                                                                |                |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |

| Platform reoccupation in the same direction is equal to the stopping headway minus 30 seconds except where        |                |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |     |
